page.title: 13NEW ABBEY - LANGUAGE
page.content: Come a' guid folks an' gether roon an' come alang wi' me, We'll tak' a dauner up the road tae lovely Shambellie. The beech,the lime,the oak an' pine are there for a' tae see, The match o' ony in the lan' is lovely Shambellie. The aul'grey brig stan's ower the burn that trinkles tae the sea; 'Twas yince a meetin' place for folks in lovely Shambellie. The days o' peace are lang since gaen an' buit a memory, As traffic rushes ower the brig thro' lovely Shambellie. The burn winds on past Abbey wa's till lost amang the trees Whaur holy men yince trod the paths o' lovely Shambellie. (Shambellie Woods border the approach road to the village from Dumfries.)
